Importing NIF data sets

Source: vignettes/importing-NIF-datasets.Rmd
importing-NIF-datasets.Rmd

This vignette describes how to import NIF data sets not created with make_nif().

BACKGROUND

NIF data sets created from SDTM data using make_nif() inherit fields from the original data that provide information on the analyte. These fields include:

  • ANALYTE (character), the name of the analyte/the administered drug. This field is derived from the PCTESTCD variable of the SDTM domain ‘PC’. Please see the vignette("nif-vignette") and the documentation to add_treatment_mapping() for details on how the analyte name can be linked to the respective drug name (i.e., EXTRT in the SDTM domain ‘EX’). The ANALYTE name is used for both, observations and administrations of the compound.

  • PARENT (character), the name of the parent compound that the analyte belongs to. This is the same as the ANALYTE for parent compounds. However, if metabolite observations are included in the data set, the PARENT field is the name of the respective parent compound. The association between analytes and their respective parent compound can be established by add_metabolite_mapping(), see also the vignette("nif-vignette").

  • METABOLITE (logical), the information whether the analyte represents a metabolite compound, i.e., is not administered.

The above fields are particularly important in cases where a NIF data set contains administrations and observations of multiple drugs, e.g., data from drug combinations studies or PK/PD data that include observations from plasma concentrations and other endpoints.

Developed by Rainer Strotmann.
